relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Rock climbing was a great activity. Countless others
Location can be considered desolate. Closest mart is about two miles away (Freshmen have restriction in automobile access). Can be depressing on a serious note.
No. Standard operation procedure for switching lifestyles, change in academic standing, and medical complications (among other reasons) results in reduction of financial aid from the University.
Dining hall has the occasional bad/bland taste but overall sufficient.
Traditional dorms are modern, clean, and up to date. Cadet dorms are built like most barracks i.e. bear bones.

Even with a little hard work and dedication there is no reason why you should fail a class because there are organizations/activities there that prepare you for success. That doesn't mean even with as much work as you can put in you will never come out with a C.

Do not commit unless you have not only visited but willing to suffer for the greater good. I have seen many in struggle while others in denial. It truly is in the eye of the beholder, however, if you plan to be a traditional student at Norwich I do not recommend you attend because you will not get the full benefits that the University offers its Cadets.
An experience you should't regret. Through all the suffering there are important lessons to be learned. Not for the faint of heart -- there is no shame in accepting if this place is not for you.
pageTitle: Norwich University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {73652=be here and observe for a while. suggestion time, september, october and february., 198689=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 118950=First year - SLEEP when you can - none allowed between 0530 - 2200 until you are recognized., 30221=Norwich University is surprisingly a normal price for an out of state college. Through my eyes being the best military college it is worth every penny. Especially considering if you apply before Nov. 15 you will get a good sum of money in institutional scholarships. Plus if you are seeking a commission like me, they (your captain in the ROTC), will fight for a full 3 to 3.5 year scholarship for you so long as you do well academically and act like you want to be there., 11380=The University is re-modeling all Corp buildings. By the Fall 2012, 4/8 buildings will be completely remodeled and look incredible. South, the new civilian building is the base of the remodels., 150142=For Graduate programs, their is approximately 1 research paper due every 3 weeks that is about 2000 words long or roughly 8-12 pages including title page and bibliography.}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot After adjusting to the new lifestyle (both the Corps of Cadets and the whole college life) I settled into my classes and found whole new sections of math and science to explore. New theories and rules keep coming as I go on in my classwork. I'm learning a lot, and sometimes it is stressful, but so interesting and exciting at the same time. And I've only just finished my freshmen year. Login to rate or flag the reviews Rugger 04/02/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 9 out of 9 people found this review useful. 3 of 45 Categories Comments Campus Safety Emergency towers all over campus. Security responds within reasonable time. Greek Life Non-existent Clubs and Activities New clubs and activities are always encouraged and endorsed by the University. The club hockey team is really good.
